name: RUTURAJ GAIKWAD
about: 16 matches, 635 runs and high score of 101* in the 2021 edition of the league, Ruturaj Gaikwad was retained by the CSK ahead of the 2022 edition of the league for INR 6 crore. The opening batter who hails from Pune, Ruturaj Gaikwad has been a consistent performer for his state team Maharashtra. He was the highest run-getter for Maharashtra in the league stage of the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2018-19. At the IPL 2019 Player Auction, the Chennai Super Kings secured his services at his base price of INR 20 lacs. He has been their most consistent opener and will look to do the same come April and May.

name: DEVON CONWAY
about: The classy and stylist top order batter, Devon Conway was bought by the CSK for his base price of INR 1 crore at the IPL 2022 Mega Auction. Born in South Africa, Devon Conway plays for New Zealand and is known for switching gears while batting and can also keep wickets if required. Conway has played 20 T20I games for New Zealand and has a strike rate of 139 plus. It will be interesting to see how CSK utilise Conway’s services.

name: MS DHONI
about: MS Dhoni added another feather to his cap in 2021 edition of the league as CSK won their fourth title. Ahead of the 2022 edition of the league, MS Dhoni was one of the four retained players by the franchise and he was retained for a sum of INR 12 crore. A batting powerhouse, MS Dhoni possesses the ability to destroy different bowling attacks on his own. The calmness and composure in his demeanor along with a sharp cricketing brain accounts for a lethal combination on the cricketing field and the glistening silverware in the trophy cabinets at CSK are a testimony to his extraordinary leadership skills. He was the face of Chennai Super Kings for the first eight editions of the league, leading them to two titles (2010 & 2011) and four runner-up finishes. He then became the first player to be drafted by Rising Pune Supergiant in the ninth edition of the league. And, he once again became the first player to be retained by CSK ahead of the IPL Player Auction 2018. The 2018 season of the league had a fairytale ending with another glistening silverware added to the trophy cabinet of the Chennai Super Kings. The 2019 edition of the league too saw the CSK reach the finals of the tournament under MS Dhoni’s leadership. While MS Dhoni has hung up his boots on a 16-year illustrious career for Team India, he was seen donning the CSK colours once again in 2020.

name: AJINKYA RAHANE
about: Ajinkya Rahane’s credentials as a batter is well known. An experienced campaigner who has played for Mumbai, India and various IPL franchises in the past, Rahane will be turning up for the Chennai Super Kings this year. Rahane has been a prolific run-scorer at the top-order in the past and he could well be the perfect foil for aggressive opening partners. A senior member who brings in with him a wealth of experience, it will be interesting to see how CSK use him in their batting line-up.

name: SHAIK RASHEED
about: Shaik Rasheed, a right-hand batter from Andhra Pradesh was picked by CSK for his base price of INR 20 lakh at the IPL Player Auction. He was a part of India U-19 team which won the 2022 U19 World Cup in February.Rasheed smashed 50 runs off 84 balls against England in the final of the 2022 U19 World Cup. The 18-year-old batter made his debut for Andhra in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2022 and scored an unbeaten 37 runs.

name: SHAMEER RIZVI
about: Shameer Rizvi is a rising cricketer and a talented batter for the Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in the Indian Premier League (IPL). Known for his aggressive batting style and ability to handle pressure situations, Rizvi has quickly made a name for himself in the cricketing world. His performances have added significant strength to the CSK lineup, making him a key player to watch. With his impressive skills and consistent performances, Rizvi is poised to become one of the standout stars in the IPL.

name: AVANISH RAO ARAVELLY
about: Avanish Rao Aravelly is an emerging star in the 2024 Indian Premier League (IPL) season, playing as a batter for the Chennai Super Kings (CSK). Known for his elegant stroke play and composure at the crease, Aravelly has quickly become a crucial part of the CSK batting lineup. His ability to build innings and accelerate scoring when needed has garnered praise from teammates and fans alike. As a young talent with a bright future, Aravelly's performances are pivotal to CSK's aspirations for the season, making him one of the most exciting players to watch in the tournament.

name: RAVINDRA JADEJA
about: Jadeja’s love affair with runs and wickets continued at IPL 2021 and he was the highest paid retention for CSK ahead of the 2022 edition of the league. The outstanding all-rounder was retained for INR 16 crore. Earlier, he became the third retained player by CSK ahead of the IPL 2018 Player Auction. Ravindra Jadeja has always been MS Dhoni’s go-to-man when he needed to break a partnership and the left-armer has delivered the goods on many occasions. His presence gives Dhoni the extra cushion of playing an additional batsman if needed. Jadeja has been an enigma right since his advent in international cricket. He was part of the victorious Indian U-19 cricket team that won the World Cup in Malaysia in 2008. His performance in IPL 2008 helped Rajasthan Royals to title victory and earned him the nickname "Rockstar" by his captain Shane Warne. In 2012 IPL player auction, Jadeja was bought by Chennai Super Kings for approx. Rs. 9.8 Crore, making him the most expensive player of the year's auction. Jadeja has represented the Gujarat Lions for two seasons and was back with CSK for the eleventh edition of the league. He has been an integral part of them ever since.

name: MITCHELL SANTNER
about: The kiwi all-rounder will once again ply his trade to the CSK at the 2022 edition of the league. A smart spinner and a handy batter, Santner was bought by CSK for INR 1.9 crore at the 2022 Mega Auction. In 2018, Santner was bought by the CSK for just INR 50 lacs, the Kiwi bowler was definitely one of the most economical buys for CSK. Santner made his debut for New Zealand when Daniel Vettori retired from his ranks and in only his first game, Santner impressed the selectors, not with the ball, but with the bat. Since his debut, Santner has been an impressive prospect although he’s had his share of ups and downs in world cricket. Santner is a handy batter lower down the order and an outstanding fielder.

name: MOEEN ALI
about: A stylist batter and one of the sweetest timers of the ball, Moeen Ali was retained by CSK for INR 8 crore ahead of the 2022 Mega Auction. The English all-rounder played 15 matches in 2021 with 357 runs and 6 wickets to his name A versatile left-handed batter and an aggressive off-break bowler, Moeen Ali was bought by Chennai Super Kings for INR 7 crores at the IPL 2021 Player Auction. The left-hander represented RCB for two seasons before he was released by the franchise ahead of the 2021 edition of the league. Moeen Ali has excellent batting skills against spin and the ability to bat at any position can take away the game from the opposition.

name: SHIVAM DUBE
about: A powerful middle-order batter and a handy medium pacer, Shivam Dube was bought by CSK for INR 4 crore at the IPL 2022 Mega Auction. What started from his base price 50 lakhs and owing to a lot of interest for this all-rounder in the auction, it went upto INR 4 cr for Dube. The all-rounder who hails from Mumbai has been making headlines for his gritty batting and bowling efforts. Shivam Dube had played junior cricket for his state before making it to the Mumbai senior team. He made his Twenty20 debut for Mumbai in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy in January 2016 and a year later made his one-day debut for the state team. On the eve of the Player Auction prior to IPL 2019, Dube made headlines as he hammered five sixes in five balls off left-arm spinner Swapnil Singh on the final day of Mumbai’s Ranji Trophy match against Baroda. Not surprisingly, he attracted fierce bidding at the auction and was eventually signed up by by the Royal Challengers Bangalore for a fee of INR 5 cr. After playing for Royal Challengers Bangalore over the course of IPL 2019 and IPL 2020, Shivam Dube was brought on board by Rajasthan Royals for INR 4.40 Cr. The Indian all-rounder has a reputation of being a clean hitter of the cricket ball and can be handy with the ball with his medium pace. Dube, who has played 24 IPL games, will be eager to shine bright for the Chennai franchise in the IPL 2022.

name: Nishant Sindhu
about: A young all-rounder from Rohtak, Nishant was instrumental in India’s U19 World Cup 2022 triumph with a fighting half-century in the Finals. Nishant was picked by the CSK for INR 60 lakhs in the IPL Player Auction 2023. Soon after the U19 Triumph, the 18-year-old all-rounder was picked in the Haryana Ranji team, wherein he made his debut against Kerala. The young gun will be looking forward to don the CSK colours and imbibe the plethora of experience and knowledge from the change room.

name: AJAY MANDAL
about: An all-rounder born in Madhya Pradesh, Ajay Mandal made his first class debut for Chhattisgarh in 2016. Ajay was picked by the CSK for his base price of INR 20 lakhs at the IPL 2023 Player Auction. Mandal has a record of scoring the maximum runs (241*) by an Indian batter at No.8 in domestic cricket. He is all set to join the CSK camp for the 16th edition of IPL.

name: RACHIN RAVINDRA
about: Rachin Ravindra is a promising New Zealand cricketer known for his all-round abilities as a left-handed batsman and left-arm orthodox spinner. Born on November 18, 1999, Ravindra has quickly made a name for himself with his solid technique and versatility on the field. He has represented New Zealand in various formats, showcasing his potential with both bat and ball. Ravindra's performances in domestic cricket and international appearances have highlighted his capability to contribute significantly in key moments, making him a valuable asset to the New Zealand cricket team and a player with a bright future ahead.

name: DARYL MITCHELL
about: Daryl Mitchell is a dynamic New Zealand cricketer renowned for his versatility and impactful performances in all formats of the game. Born on May 20, 1991, he is a right-handed batsman and a right-arm medium pace bowler. Mitchell's tenacity and skill have earned him a reputation as a reliable all-rounder, capable of anchoring the innings or accelerating the scoring rate as needed. His notable contributions include crucial innings in Test and One Day International matches, where his composure under pressure has often turned the tide in New Zealand's favor. Mitchell's dedication and consistent performances have solidified his place as a key player in the New Zealand national team.

name: SHARDUL THAKUR
about: He has a knack to take wickets and possesses an ability to score important runs. Shardul Thakur, who was one of the highlights in the Chennai Super Kings’ victory in the last season’s final, will be donning the Delhi Capitals’ colours this season after the franchise had him on board for INR 10.75 Crore. Shardul, who represents Mumbai in domestic cricket, has been one of the most consistent performers for Team India in recent times and he will be keen to leave his mark in the TATA IPL 2022.

name: RICHARD GLEESON
about: The English fast bowler, Gleeson, was added to the CSK squad of IPL 2024 as a replacement of injured Devon Conway. The right arm pacer has represented England in six T20Is and has nine wickets to his name. Additionally, Gleeson has played 90 T20s and picked 101 T20 wickets.

name: RAJVARDHAN HANGARGEKAR
about: 19 year old Rajvardhan was part of the recently concluded U19 Cricket World Cup that Team India won. The fiery fast bowler and a power hitter who can also be used as a finisher, Rajvardhan saw quite an interest at the auction room and was finally snapped by the CSK for INR 1.5 crore. It will be interesting to see how MS Dhoni utilizes this youngster’s services.

name: DEEPAK CHAHAR
about: CSK boy, Deepak Chahar is back with CSK for the 2022 edition of the league. It turned out to be fierce bidding war for the swing bowler, with SRH and Delhi Capitals starting the bids for Deepak and later were joined by RR and CSK for the same. It was as if the CSK had decided to get their man back into the ranks and finally succeeded in the same with a price of INR 14 crore. The Agra-born medium pacer, Deepak Chahar was a part of the Rajasthan Royals squad in 2012, donned the RPS jersey for two seasons and was bought by the Chennai Super Kings in the eleventh edition of the league. Chahar has risen through the ranks and his ability to swing the new ball both ways with control is what makes him a lot more lethal at the top. Chahar also possesses the ability to hit handy runs lower down the order and his current exploits, a match winning knock against Sri Lanka and a 34 ball 54 against South Africa has been the talk of the town. Ahead of the 2018 season, Deepak was picked by the Chennai Super Kings and medium-pacer had a breakthrough 2018 IPL season taking 10 wickets in 12 matches. He was then subsequently rewarded with an India call-up in limited-overs cricket.

name: MAHEESH THEEKSHANA
about: Mystery spinner from Sri Lanka makes his way in IPL 2022 as the Chennai Super Kings bought him for INR 70 lakhs at the 2022 Mega Auction. KKR and CSK both showed interest in the 21-year-old youngster, but it was the CSK who bagged him into their camp. With 15 T20I matches to his name, it will be interesting to see how he is utilized here for the IPL.

name: MUKESH CHOUDHARY
about: Leading wicket-taker for Maharashtra in Vijay Hazare Trophy 2021-22, Mukesh Choudhary was bought by CSK for his base price of INR 20 lakhs at the IPL 2022 Mega Auction. This will be Mukesh’s dream come true moment as he is all set to enter the IPL fold and share the dressing room with the big guns at CSK

name: MUSTAFIZUR RAHMAN
about: Mustafizur Rahman is a left-arm pace bowler who came to Dhaka in 2012 to try his luck at a fast-bowler’s camp, after he had impressed in an Under-17 tournament in his hometown Satkhira. He was admitted to the Bangladesh Cricket Board's pace foundation and soon caught the coaches' attention to make the Bangladesh Under-19 side for the 2014 World Cup. He initially lacked pace, but built it up through the 2014-15 first-class season, when he took 26 wickets. An international call up came soon and Mustafizur impressed straightaway making some of the best in the business look tentative against him. He enjoyed great success against India in the Asia Cup in 2016 and caught the eye worldwide for his ability to generate good pace and for his deceptive slower one. The IPL 2016 was his first stint with the IPL and he was known for his lethal yorker to KKR all-rounder Andre Russell. He was impressive for SRH last year and would be looking to do well in the 2017 edition as well. RR acquired Mustafizur's services after bringing him on the board for INR 1 Cr. The left-arm pacer from Bangladesh has thus far played five IPL seasons and has 46 IPL wickets to his name and he will be looking to add a few more wickets to his tally as the Delhi Capitals look to clinch the title in TATA IPL 2023.

name: PRASHANT SOLANKI
about: A debut at the IPL auction for Prashant Solanki and it indeed was one to remember for the 22 year old who hails from Mumbai. It started from his base price of 20 lakhs with RR and CSK, both bidding fiercely for the youngster and in the end, it was CSK who bagged him for INR 1.20 crore. The right-arm leggie from Mumbai is an interesting prospect for the CSK camp.

name: SIMARJEET SINGH
about: The tall, skiddy pacer who was a net bowler with the Delhi Capitals was bought by Chennai Super Kings for his base price of INR 20 lakhs at the IPL 2022 Mega Auction.

name: TUSHAR DESHPANDE
about: The Mumbai lad, Tushar Deshpande was picked by the CSK for his base price of INR 20 lakhs at the IPL 2022 Mega Auction. Tushar made his FC debut in 2016 and has been performing in the domestic circuit. Earlier, Tushar has represented the Delhi Capitals and has played 5 games in the IPL. This season, Tushar is all set to join the yellow army.

name: MATHEESHA PATHIRANA
about: Matheesha Pathirana was roped in by the Chennai Super Kings in IPL 2022 as a player replacement for the injured Adam Milne. Born on 18 December 2002 in Kandy, Sri Lanka, the 19-year-old right-arm medium pacer and right-handed batter featured in Sri Lanka's U19 World Cup squads in 2020 and 2022. It will be interesting to see how the young talented pacer will be utilized in CSK's plans for the 2022 edition of the tournament.

name: FAF DU PLESSIS
about: On March 12, 2022 the former RCB Skipper, Virat Kohli announced that he would be passing on the baton tow Faf du Plessis, who will be the new Captain for the RCB. It will be an all new setup, change in team colours for Faf du Plessis who will be representing the RCB the 2022 edition of the league. The veteran batter from South Africa was bought by the RCB for INR 7 crore at the IPL 2022 Mega Auction. Faf du Plessis started his IPL journey with the CSK and has played for them ever since. The right-handed batter played an all-important knock in the Finals of the 2021 edition of the league, scoring 86 runs off 59 deliveries, thereby winning the Player of the Match for the same. In 2018, Punjab Kings bought Faf for INR 1.6cr, but but CSK trumped them by using their RTM card and it sure was a bargain for them. While the classy and composed batsman did not get many outings in the RPS squad where he was picked up in the IPL player draft, du Plessis had consistent performances for CSK wherein he went on to have a very successful debut season scoring 398 runs. He impressed with a half-century on his ODI debut, against India and soon enough, found himself in South Africa’s squad for the 2011 World Cup. With a century on Test debut against Australia, du Plessis has shed the tag of a limited-overs specialist. Although batting remains his area of prowess, du Plessis can come up with a few handy leg-spinners when required. To boot that, he is a livewire in the field, hence, making him a perfect T20 package for any captain.

name: RAJAT PATIDAR
about: Born in Indore, Madhya Pradesh, Rajat Patidar joined RCB in IPL 2022 as a replacement of the injured Luvnith Sisodia for the price of INR 20 Lakh. The right-handed batter, who represents Madhya Pradesh in domestic cricket, has scored 861 runs in 31 T20 games where he has featured for the side, with 7 half-centuries and a high score of 96. Rajat previously represented RCB in IPL 2021 and scored 71 runs in the four games he played in the season. The 28-year old batter, on the back of his domestic experience, can strengthen the RCB middle-order and play a pivotal role in the team’s longevity and success in the tournament.

name: JITESH SHARMA
about: The Vidarbha wicketkeeper-batter has thus far played 54 T20s and scored 1329 runs with the strike rate of 141.83. He was bought by the PBKS for INR 20 Lac.

name: GLENN PHILLIPS
about: The New Zealand wicketkeeper-batsman joined Rajasthan Royals in 2021 as a replacement for Jofra Archer. Phillips, played just 3 matches in that edition of the IPL and was mostly known for his superman-like fielding efforts on the field. He has thus far played 35 T20Is and has 645 runs against his name with the help of one hundred and two half-centuries.
